articles.title: A post-Budget 2025 world can be one of opportunity for public servants | Opinion
articles.description: The reset proposed for the public service in the budget doesn’t need to be a cause for panic.

articles.title: Why so upset about Ottawa Police getting more money? | Opinion
articles.description: Mohammed Adam: The disconnect between the police and some of those they serve is on display ever year at budget time.

articles.title: Will Carney’s energy deal with Alberta give him clout against Trump’s tariffs?
articles.description: 'If I were the United States, I’d have a little bit of fear of missing out and that would incentivize me to negotiate,' said Heather Exner-Pirot

articles.title: Former Alberta premier Jason Kenney says politician recall legislation being misused
articles.description: CALGARY — The architect of Alberta’s politician recall legislation says it was never meant to be used as a political weapon, but as an “ultimate tool of accountability” if a politician engages in illegal or unethical behaviour. Jason Kenney gave the remarks in an interview Thursday

articles.title: Critics question Saab’s offer to bring 10,000 aerospace jobs to Canada
articles.description: OTTAWA — Critics are questioning the solidity of Saab’s pitch to deliver 10,000 jobs in Canada if it decides to set up shop here to assemble Gripen fighter jets. The Swedish company has said little about how it came to that number, making it hard to evaluate the offer. Saab spokesperson Jenny

articles.title: How full-time return-to-office might further strain Ottawa's child-care system
articles.description: Advocates say Ottawa's current system could not meet the additional demand from parents returning to their offices five days a week.

articles.title: Canada added 54,000 jobs in November, unemployment rate drops to 6.5%: StatCan
articles.description: OTTAWA — The labour market surprised economists again in November with a third straight month of job gains. Statistics Canada said Friday that the economy added 54,000 new positions last month compared with economists’ expectations for a small loss. The unemployment rate fell to 6.5 per cent in Nove
